content.description: Start on the left side where there is an easy ledge for your feet. Find two holds above and traverse to the high foot start from Minuteman Hurdle. Top out from there.

Come to the front with the tree to the right of the face. Find the two upside-down triangle natural cuts near the crack line. Below, there is a foothold slightly above knee height. The initial move will be a jump up, then use the cuts as footholds (foot jamming?). There are occasional holds all around, but it's mainly leg strength. Once you get up, it's just a ledge swing-over. You can also use the tree occasionally, if need be.
content.protection: Possibly pad if you want to take more extreme routes. There is an old anchor stuck in a crack out right.
content.location: Follow the Dismal Harmony path from either E. Main Street or Tingley, walk back on the white path (I think?) and cross the river to the right. At the split, head up the mountain up the steep grade, and then at the top (ridge line) turn right and follow it until you see the rock. There will be a path leading to it.

content.description: Start in the space between the two halves of Legend Rock with two hands on a one pad crimp. Move left around the corner on pleasant crimps, followed by a really big move past the blank section to a jug. Topout is easy.Variations: Go straight up the corner after the first move left. This would be necessary if you can't reach the long move, and is quite hard on its own. Another great problem is to keep going left along the crimps and topping out up the arete (bad landing!) or past the tree.
content.location: In the space between the two halves of Legend Rock

content.description: On the far right of the boulder, start low and go up the jugs. Tons of variations depending on how far right and low you start. Traversing left and right on the huge ledge is a good warmup.
Start with the hands in the obvious crack line, about halfway of the the possible traverse listed within Legend of Korra. Jugs, crimps, and foot/leg jam is included! Top-out is the crux.
content.location: To the left of Legend of Korra, and across-right to I am Legend.

content.description: "The most interesting rock outcrop in Mendham Township." A cool boulder with lots of interesting features, offering a variety of easy climbing along with tougher crimpy lines.
